alert.note: Alert for Effingham (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 8:38PM CDT until August 03 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR EFFINGHAM COUNTY... At 815 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding from thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Numerous roads in Effingham were closed due to flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Effingham, Altamont, Teutopolis, Watson, Dieterich, Beecher City, Edgewood, Shumway, Montrose, Moccasin, Mason, Heartville, Effingham County Airport, Lake Sara, Altamont Reservoir and Elliotstown. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
